title: If a trait has a supertrait with associated items, don't print those in diagnostics

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=6984f6826de1125683b09a294e7fdb18

```rust
use bytes::Bytes; // 1.1.0
use hyper::body::HttpBody; // 0.14.19

trait MyBody: Unpin + Send + Sync + 'static + HttpBody<Data = Bytes, Error = Box<dyn std::error::Error + Send + Sync>> {}
impl MyBody for Box<dyn MyBody> {}

fn foo(x: impl MyBody) {}

fn main() {
    foo(Box::new(0));
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): the trait bound `Box<{integer}>: MyBody` is not satisfied
  --> src/main.rs:10:9
   |
10 |     foo(Box::new(0));
   |     --- ^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `MyBody` is not implemented for `Box<{integer}>`
   |     |
   |     required by a bound introduced by this call
   |
   = help: the following implementations were found:
             <Box<(dyn MyBody<Data = bytes::Bytes, Error = Box<(dyn std::error::Error + Send + Sync + 'static)>> + 'static)> as MyBody>
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): the trait bound `Box<{integer}>: MyBody` is not satisfied
  --> src/main.rs:10:9
   |
10 |     foo(Box::new(0));
   |     --- ^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `MyBody` is not implemented for `Box<{integer}>`
   |     |
   |     required by a bound introduced by this call
   |
   = help: the following implementations were found:
             <Box<(dyn MyBody + 'static)> as MyBody>
```

<!--
If the problem is not self-explanatory, please provide a rationale for the
change.
-->

The associated types from the supertrait are already fixed by the trait requirements; printing them again isn't helpful and can be misleading.

<!--
If dramatically different output is caused by small changes, consider also
adding them here.

If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions. The output might also be
different depending on the Edition.
-->
